tourName: Tailor Made South African Family Getaway
placesVisited: Cape Town, Hermanus, Cape Wine Lands, Durban, Zimbali, Phinda Game Reserve, Soweto, Johannesburg
generalInfo: This 7-day safari will have you exploring the length and breadth of South Africa, tantalizing your senses with the glistening yellow and tangerine hues, sweet scents from the wildflower gardens, and mouthwatering, local flavors. The friendly faces, great weather, and opulence of the hotels will be your cherry on top and a testament as to why South Africa is the ultimate family holiday destination.

dayInfo.title: Cape Town – Introductory Tour of the City
dayInfo.description: When you arrive at Cape Town International Airport, you will be met by your private tour guide who will welcome you and transfer you to your luxury hotel, which will be your home for the next two days. Upon checking in, you will be given time to freshen up and bask in the moment as you get ready to venture on an exploration of the city. This city tour will be an excellent way to begin your trip as it will be a great way for you to get to understand the history and essence of Cape Town, which by now, you will be able to say is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Table Mountain is one of the new natural world wonders and will be your stop for the day. The aerial cableway will lift you to about 302 meters above sea level to the top of this wondrous mountaintop where you will be able to truly see the world from a bird’s eye view and take in the fresh air while appreciating the indescribable view of the city. After you are done indulging in the irreplaceable sights, you will be transferred back to your hotel for the rest of the evening.

dayInfo.title: Hermanus – Spend a Day in the Whale Watching Capital of the World
dayInfo.description: After breakfast, your guide will take you on a drive along the Cape coastline, stopping to sink your feet in the warm, white sands of the long stretches of beaches as you make your way to the whale watching capital of the world: Hermanus. This quaint fishing village really shows off its beauty and the sounds of the whales and birds in addition to the colorful display of natural wildflower gardens that exude sweet, enchanting scents that you can actually taste. You will be spoiled for choice when it comes to whale watching options. You can watch these colossal creatures while relaxing on the private beach, from a private boat, or an exclusive helicopter. While this is a very popular and exclusive tour, there is no absolute guarantee that you will be able to see whales. Please note that the prime whale watching season is from June to November. This afternoon can be spent engaging in various activities like chasing the wind on horseback as you sprint across the flowery planes or by paragliding through the crisp, South African, sky. Kayaking, ziplining, sandboarding, and quad biking are other great options for a fun-filled afternoon of thrills for your whole family.You will enjoy a quiet night in your hotel or walking down the beach as you make the most out of your last few moments in Cape Town.

dayInfo.title: Durban – Explore the City of Durban
dayInfo.description: Sawubona means hello, and it is how you will be greeted on day three as you land in the Zulu Kingdom of Durban, which boasts a melting pot of culture and flavors that will amaze your senses. On arrival at the King Ushaka airport, you will be transferred to your five-star hotel for check-in and a warm welcome. Your guide will pick you up for your day in the scenic Valley of a Thousand Hills that is complete with dense, green foliage and meandering pathways. It is in this valley where you will find the few Zulu people who have chosen to remain unaffected by the modern world, and who will be proudly draped in their regalia and colorful beads that hang delicately around their necks. Each color is a symbol of their talents, achievements, and lineages. Their craftsmanship is evident in their wood, metal, clay, wax, and fabric crafts. Each piece is carved with purpose and tells a story of belonging and cultural pride for which the people are known and admired. It is also in this valley where the views of the Drakensberg mountains and the Indian ocean are at their very best, and you will be able to appreciate the scenery as you are driven back to the Durban Metropolis. Lunch will be served at one of the top restaurants where you will be treated to delectable delicacies that are unique to this region. Durban is also the spice capital of South Africa so you can be assured of an experience like no other as the different flavors unite in your mouth and will forever remain etched on your pallet. The rest of your night can be spent relaxing in your hotel and enjoying the cool breeze and sounds that originate from the ocean.

dayInfo.title: Phinda Game Reserve – Discover the Big 5
dayInfo.description: You will be immersed in 23,000 hectares of prime Big Five wilderness as you will be taken on a wildlife safari at the Phinda Game Reserve. This game reserve, which is home to Africa’s Big Five, is also a habitat for over 380 bird species and a variety of other smaller animals that can easily be spotted with the help of your expert guide. Phinda Game Reserve is a sanctuary for endangered wildlife, meaning that the animals are tracked and this increases the chances of seeing all these mighty predators as they survey the grasslands or take a dip at the many watering holes. After a day with the wild animals, you will return to your hotel where you can enjoy a gourmet dinner as you stargaze under the clear sky and prepare for another memorable day.

dayInfo.title: Drakensberg – Uncover Ancient Rock Paintings at Zimbali
dayInfo.description: You will have the chance to spend your morning of day five at the Drakensberg mountains range, which one of South Africa’s most spectacular mountain ranges at 3,482 meters above sea level. The Drakensberg mountain range showcases a selection of the breathtaking, geographical artistry: each peak refuses to shrink but displaying its uniqueness with the snow capes that sometimes cover them. A walk along crystal-clear, natural streams and glades will be very calming as you will be able to truly appreciate the wonder of nature The ancient Bushmen rock paintings are a great attraction as they are a reminder of the ancient way of life. The mystic symbols and signs are a testament of the thriving lifestyles and San people who once occupied the region. The Didima Rock Art Centre is another great, cultural prism with unique pottery displays that have been completed by the locals. You will enjoy a lunch and a peaceful afternoon at a luxurious estate, viewing the well-curated golf fields and being treated to some of the organic spa treatments. Your guide will then transfer you to your hotel for dinner and some cultural displays that await you on your last night in Durban.

dayInfo.title: Johannesburg – Exclusive Tour of the City's Historic Sites
dayInfo.description: The Johannesburg magic will captivate you as you descend in the plane from Durban. You and your family will get an opportunity to tour around the streets of gold and take a historical and political journey through the corridors of the Apartheid Museum at Constitution Hill. Here, your guide will give you all the stories and nuances behind these monuments. Your children will have the thrill of their lives at Gold Reef City, which is not only a thrill ride park but is a historical site where you will understand why Johannesburg is called the City of Gold. Upon returning to your hotel, you will freshen up and then enjoy an evening at your exclusive hotel where you will be treated to the best of South African Cuisine as you watch the bright lights that illuminate the city.

dayInfo.title: Soweto – Cultural Display and Nelson Mandela Home Visit
dayInfo.description: The South Western Townships that is popularly known as Soweto is the heart of Johannesburg because of its history. This will be your last destination on this enchanting vacation. Here, you will walk down the same road that was walked by two Nobel Prize winners: Desmond Tutu and the Late Nelson Mandela. A visit to the Mandela residence will give you a good understanding of the story behind this world icon. The gumboot dancers will wow you with their talent and have you laughing with guttural guffaws as you join in and try a move or two. The color and ambiance of the streets and friendly faces of South Africa will be yours for the taking. Though you will be saying goodbye to this rainbow nation, you will be able to have that one piece of art that will forever remind you of your time in South Africa. Your guide will transfer you to the airport where you will take a connecting flight back home. Hamba Kahle, which means Goodbye.
